alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:53AM EST until December 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Squannacook River At West Groton affecting Middlesex County. For the Squannacook River...including West Groton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Squannacook River at West Groton. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Minor flooding affects the lowest lying sections of Townsend, including the farmland along Turnpike and Barker Hill roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.0 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.0 feet on 09/12/1954. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM EST.
